name: apify-ai-sandbox
title: Apify AI Sandbox
description: Apify AI Sandbox Actor that allows execution of code and operations in a containerized environment for AI coding agents

input.title: Actor input schema
input.description:
AI Sandbox for running AI coding operations in a containerized environment. ðŸš€

## How to use
* **Connect with MCP client:** Use a Model Context Protocol (MCP) client to interact with this sandbox. See https://modelcontextprotocol.io/clients
* **Use Apify SDK:** Connect programmatically using the Apify SDK for direct integration
* **REST API:** Access the sandbox directly via REST API endpoints

## Configuration
* **Memory & timeout:** Configure run options below to set memory allocation and execution timeout
* **Check logs:** Open the Actor run log console to view connection details and operation output

nodeDependencies.title: Node.js Dependencies
nodeDependencies.description: npm package.json dependencies object for JavaScript and TypeScript code execution (/sandbox/js-ts). Paste your dependencies in npm format. Example: {"zod": "^3.0", "axios": "latest"}

pythonRequirementsTxt.title: Python Requirements
pythonRequirementsTxt.description:
Python requirements in requirements.txt format for Python code execution (/sandbox/py). Paste your dependencies one per line. Example:
 requests==2.31.0
pandas>=2.0.0

initShellScript.title: Initialization Script
initShellScript.description: Optional bash script to customize the sandbox environment. Runs after library installation in /sandbox directory. Use for installing system packages, creating directories, or other setup tasks.
initShellScript.prefill:
apt-get update
# apt-get install -y curl
# mkdir /sandbox/data

idleTimeoutSeconds.title: Idle Timeout Seconds
idleTimeoutSeconds.description: The container will automatically shut down after this period of inactivity (no requests, no shell interaction). Set to 0 to disable. Recommended to set Actor execution timeout to 0 (infinite) when using this.
